stimulusHtml: Assume that the market demand for a good is perfectly inelastic, the market supply for the good is perfectly elastic, and the market is in equilibrium. If there is a decrease in the price of a key input used in the production of the good, which of the following will occur?
choicesHtml: There will be a decrease in the equilibrium quantity.
There will be no change in the producer surplus.
There will be a decrease in the producer surplus.
There will be a decrease in the consumer surplus.
There will be an increase in the equilibrium price.
